description:
It would be nice to see Mozilla's current rendering mode (quirks or standards)
as a small icon, probably in the window footer bar.  The icon would change to
indicate that Mozilla is rendering in Standards Compliance Mode or Quirks Mode,
providing at-a-glance info without the need to visit the Page Info window each
time.  If adding another icon would confuse/bother the non-interested, it could
be a preferences option -- but I doubt it would be intrusive.    

The benefits of such a feature would help web "developers" to notice when their
webpages are non-compliant -- not just the obvious pages, but the ones they
forgot about.  It would also serve as a bellwether for www standards compliance
in general, as you surf around.  Lastly, it would be a smidge faster/easier to
debug external pages that have Mozilla render issues, as a first step. 

iCab has a similar feature, where the browser has a tiny smiling icon that
appears when a page is standards-compliant.  http://www.icab.de/smile.html
summary: Need icon for Quirks vs. Standards Mode
